fulltext:
TRUNG NGUYEN  
Birthday: 24th Sep 1987  
Email: ttrung2409@gmail.com 
Github: https://github.com/ttrung2409 
Phone: +84 933 096 626 
OVERVIEW 
Developer with 10 year experience in .NET, NodeJS, Javascript, Sql programming, front-end 
technologies, and strong background of architectural / design patterns. 
I have gained experiences from windows, web and mobile development. There were large apps 
requiring decent architecture and well-organised code in order to be sustainably developed and 
maintained. 
Communication skill, determination and dedication are what allow me to successfully fulfill my 
responsibilities and produce results at high quality. 
SKILLS 
Web Development Languages 
C#, ASP.NET MVC, WCF, LINQ, Entity Framework, Web API 
Javascript, Angular, VueJS, ReactJS, RxJS, jQuery, HTML, CSS 
NodeJS, Express, Sequelize  
Mobile Development Languages 
Android native, Xamarin, Nativescript 
Architectural / design patterns 
MVC, MVVM, CQRS, Event Sourcing, Gang of Four, Redux  
Development principles 
SOLID, DDD, SOA, Microservices 
Database 
MSSQL, PostgreSQL 
Development Tools 
Visual Studio, Android Studio, Git, Azure DevOps, JIRA 
Others 
ERP 
EXPERIENCE 
Senior developer 
Augen Software Group, HCMC, Vietnam 
Apr 2017 – Present (2 years) 
The product was a SPA web app for a car rental company. It adopted Vue / Vuex as the front-end 
framework and the team was happy for that decision. We was able to utilize it as a component-based 
framework, its flexibility in template binding, its capability of composing a new component by mixing 
smaller components together, and finally ES6. The back end was built as separate services with an API 
gateway, though it was still in a monolithic manner, it was maintainable and scalable.  
My responsibilities: 
- 
Involved in the architectural decision making as the project kicked off 
- 
Was responsible for framework development and maintenance 
- 
Code review, code refactoring 
- 
Developed features as per requirements 
- 
Wrote unit tests for critical areas 
Technologies involved: C#, Web API, Vue / Vuex, Azure Storage 
Development Team Lead 
Brand Developers Limited, HCMC, Vietnam  
November 2012 – November 2015 (3 years) 
The product was a Warehouse Management SPA web app helping user record their activities in 
warehouse, i.e. purchase order, receiving, shipping, cycle count... It adopted Angular JS (aka Angular 1) 
which was an emerging innovative Javascript framework back then, Angular’s powerful two-way binding 
and the capability of writing reusable components allowed the team to build a solid front-end framework, 
thus escalated the development pace. On the back end, it adopted DDD as the development methodology, 
so that multiple teams could work independently within different bounded contexts. It used Greg Young 
Event Store as the Event Sourcing technique, also as a message bus to communicate between aggregates. 
It used CQRS to separate read & write, so that a NoSQL database could be leveraged for read optimization. 
My responsibilities: 
- 
Managed a small development team in VN to collaborate with NZ team in backlog refinement and 
problem solving  
- 
Was accountable for front-end framework development and maintenance 
- 
Developed features as per requirements 
Technologies involved: C#, Raven, AngularJS, DDD, CQRS, Event Sourcing 
Software Developer 
BYS Joint Stock Company, HCMC, Vietnam 
Sep 2009 – November 2012 (3 year 2 months) 
The product was an ERP desktop app for local enterprises comprising multiple modules, each module 
represents a group of activities of the enterprise, i.e. sale, purchase, warehousing, accounting. It had a 
robust framework which allowed to develop features quickly and efficiently. It built a lightweight ORM 
layer on its own with the intent of getting a full control over data access. It solely relied on Stored 
Procedure to deal with complicated queries and commands. It used DevExpress for the UI to take 
advantage of its two-way data binding. 
My responsibilities: 
- 
Consulted customers for their demands, and turned them into software requirements. 
- 
Was accountable for the framework development and maintenance 
- 
Developed features as per requirements 
- 
Tailored demos to new projects 
Technologies involved: C#, Microsoft SQL Server, T-SQL, DevExpress 
QUALIFICATIONS 
Vietnam University of Natural Sciences 
Bachelor of Science, Computer Software Engineering 
2005 – 2009 
Studies focused on software development, IT project management and information system. 
INTERESTS 
Music    Instrumental, rock 
Sport     Basketball, swimming

educations.major: Biểu diễn nhạc cụ phương tây

experiences.detail:
) The product was a SPA web app for a car rental company. It adopted Vue / Vuex as the front-end framework and the team was happy for that decision. We was able to utilize it as a component-based framework, its flexibility in template binding, its capability of composing a new component by mixing smaller components together, and finally ES6. The back end was built as separate services with an API gateway, though it was still in a monolithic manner, it was maintainable and scalable.
My responsibilities:
- Involved in the architectural decision making as the project kicked off
- Was responsible for framework development and maintenance
- Code review, code refactoring
- Developed features as per requirements
- Wrote unit tests for critical areas
Technologies involved: C#, Web API, Vue / Vuex, Azure Storage

(3 years)
The product was a Warehouse Management SPA web app helping user record their activities in warehouse, i.e. purchase order, receiving, shipping, cycle count... It adopted Angular JS (aka Angular 1) which was an emerging innovative Javascript framework back then, Angular’s powerful two-way binding and the capability of writing reusable components allowed the team to build a solid front-end framework, thus escalated the development pace. On the back end, it adopted DDD as the development methodology, so that multiple teams could work independently within different bounded contexts. It used Greg Young Event Store as the Event Sourcing technique, also as a message bus to communicate between aggregates.
It used CQRS to separate read & write, so that a NoSQL database could be leveraged for read optimization.
My responsibilities:
- Managed a small development team in VN to collaborate with NZ team in backlog refinement and problem solving
- Was accountable for front-end framework development and maintenance
- Developed features as per requirements
Technologies involved: C#, Raven, AngularJS, DDD, CQRS, Event Sourcing

(3 year 2 months)
The product was an ERP desktop app for local enterprises comprising multiple modules, each module represents a group of activities of the enterprise, i.e. sale, purchase, warehousing, accounting. It had a robust framework which allowed to develop features quickly and efficiently. It built a lightweight ORM layer on its own with the intent of getting a full control over data access. It solely relied on Stored Procedure to deal with complicated queries and commands. It used DevExpress for the UI to take advantage of its two-way data binding.
My responsibilities:
- Consulted customers for their demands, and turned them into software requirements.
- Was accountable for the framework development and maintenance
- Developed features as per requirements
- Tailored demos to new projects
Technologies involved: C#, Microsoft SQL Server, T-SQL, DevExpress
